intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides f. actinoideum, commonly known as the star-shaped bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
